title: Sky Qiu
text: My name is Sky Qiu. I am currently a Biostatistics PhD student at UC Berkeley, advised by Mark van der Laan. My research lies at the intersection of machine learning and causal inference. Recently, my interest has been in developing estimators under the targeted learning framework, with applications in the integration of randomized controlled trial and external real-world observational data. Welcome to my website!

title: Talks and posters
text:
Talks

2024

Super-efficient estimation of average treatment effect based on randomized controlled trial augmented with real-world data. The International Society for Biopharmaceutical Statistics 7th Symposium. Baltimore, MD. 3/8



2023

The effect of metformin adherence on COVID-19 mortality in Mexico. American Public Health Association Annual Meeting & Expo (APHA). Atlanta, GA. 11/14

title: Publications
text:
Here is a list of my own and collaborated publications:

Mark van der Laan, Sky Qiu & Lars van der Laan (2024). Adaptive-TMLE for the Average Treatment Effect based on Randomized Controlled Trial Augmented with Real-World Data. arXiv preprint. [Paper]
Zachary Butzin-Dozier, Sky Qiu, Alan E Hubbard, Junming Shi & Mark van der Laan (2024). Highly adaptive LASSO: Machine learning that provides valid nonparametric inference in realistic models. medRxiv preprint. [Paper]
Sky Qiu, Alan Hubbard, Juan Pablo Gutiérrez, Ganesh Pimpale, Alturo Juárez-Flores, Rakesh Ghosh, Ivan Ascencio-Montiel & Stefano Bertozzi (2024). Estimating the effect of realistic improvements of metformin adherence on COVID-19 mortality using targeted machine learning. Global Epidemiology, 100142. [Paper]
Toru Shirakawa, Yi Li, Yulun Wu, Sky Qiu, Yuxuan Li, Mingduo Zhao, Hiroyasu Iso & Mark van der Laan (2024). Longitudinal targeted minimum loss-based estimation with temporal-difference heterogeneous transformer. International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) 2024. [Paper]
